snippet: A prosecutor said Wednesday that Officer Brentley Vinson will not face charges in the Sept. 20 shooting of Keith Lamont Scott, whose death set off days of unrest....
lead_paragraph: A prosecutor said Wednesday that Officer Brentley Vinson will not face charges in the Sept. 20 shooting of Keith Lamont Scott, whose death set off days of unrest.
abstract: Mecklenburg County, NC, District Attorney R Andrew Murray declines to press charges against Police Officer Brentley Vinson in shooting death of black man Keith L Scott in Charlotte, NC, arguing circumstances justified shooting; key part of Murray's argument is video and digital image evidence that he says confirms Scott was armed and did not heed warnings to drop it when he was shot by Vinson, who is also black.

headline.main: Charlotte Officer ‘Justified’ in Fatal Shooting of Keith Scott
headline.print_headline: Police Shooting Found Justified in N. Carolina

byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from Raleigh, and Alan Blinder from Charleston, S.C. Christopher Mele and Timothy Williams contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER
